body_html: Dunno....my first suspicion would be that it's related to dynamic linking. Both MKL and TensorFlow are .so files loaded with dlopen, at which point dynamic linker tries to resolve all the symbols, remap all internal references to global variables and do other dark magic. If .so libraries were compiled with incompatible flags, bad things happen, like tensorflow/models#523

body: Dunno....my first suspicion would be that it's related to dynamic linking. Both MKL and TensorFlow are .so files loaded with dlopen, at which point dynamic linker tries to resolve all the symbols, remap all internal references to global variables and do other dark magic. If .so libraries were compiled with incompatible flags, bad things happen, like https://github.com/tensorflow/models/issues/523
